titleStmt.title: The high-vvay to riches, or A meanes to prevent poverty: containing a brief description of that child of chase or Lady Pecunia. Whereunto is added a brief representation of all idle or extraordinary expences, with all their amounts to in the year: together with an exact table shewing how much divers principal sums (with interest upon interest) amount to in several years, after 10. or 8. in the hundred, &c. Very necessary and fit to be regarded by all those who out of a wary disposition intend to thrive in city or country.
titleStmt.author: T. D.

titleStmt.title: The high-vvay to riches, or A meanes to prevent poverty: containing a brief description of that child of chase or Lady Pecunia. Whereunto is added a brief representation of all idle or extraordinary expences, with all their amounts to in the year: together with an exact table shewing how much divers principal sums (with interest upon interest) amount to in several years, after 10. or 8. in the hundred, &c. publicationStmt.pubPlace: London printed, and licensed according to order. :

notesStmt.note: Verse: "SHe is a Lady of such matchless carriage ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
